document.title: Ohioâ€™s Learning Standards for Fine Arts: Music 2024

34DB3F71CC6E4A9A8446A1E8794E3B0A.description:
Analyze the ethical and legal issues
surrounding the access and use of musical works (audio
and video recordings, printed and digital sheet music).

840C9395F71D4D899526C561BC49DEE3.description:
Evaluate potential musical performance
career choices and develop a personal strategic career
plan.

F1F175DF432343E8ABFAC150196FBDA7.description:
Compare and contrast a musical work with
another work of art (dance, drama, visual art) from
different cultures based on cultural influences.

F444CF1F1F1441028C5C09989DD10EC9.description:
Compare music from a variety of cultures and
historical periods.

CC7FB8331CC846DF8CFF527E2F24C03E.description: Connecting: Artists/students understand and communicate the value of creative expressions in internal and external contexts.

A836E7A38AE4467D8CB1863540560ACA.description:
Apply strategies to improve and evaluate
individual performance that can help demonstrate learning
and progress made in the development of music skill and
music literacy.

C15C0B88AC2740369AD1EEC8EC1491DD.description:
Identify and explain the expressive intent,
emotion, and meaning of musical works by citing evidence
through appropriate terminology, context, or the setting of
the text and a variety of researched sources.

1A22B20E7DC44D808924CCB90D123986.description:
Critique the ensemble performance using
established criteria that focuses on pitch, rhythm,
characteristic tone quality and intonation, and use of
dynamics and articulations.

85961B0A16CB46F0A48FEA3CBE013474.description: Responding: Artists/students engage in analysis and interpretation to understand and evaluate artistic works.

0B9D575AD1AE43739649A5614E4682D3.description:
Respond appropriately to the cues of the
conductor.

9A5A84F936B34F0AA6C1C243B8B282CF.description:
Develop strategies using feedback from peers and
outside sources in a rehearsal setting to address technical
and expressive challenges in a varied repertoire of music.

E39A5B4C4A65415FB232B2C61BB29A19.description:
Perform a varied repertoire of prepared and
improvised music representing a variety of cultures, styles,
and genres.

A57CBA836D10448AB5678A4F4B94508B.description:
Perform compositions intended for sight reading
with correct pitches, correct rhythms, characteristic tone,
accurate intonation, printed dynamics, and printed
articulations.

BD36BF11AC464DCFBDD1868820C3FA08.description:
Perform prepared or improvised music with
technical accuracy (speed, manual dexterity, articulation,
range) and printed expressive characteristics, such as
phrasing.

99EC42B019FA4CAFB5C173B47F692C70.description:
Demonstrate proficiency in eight major and four
minor key signatures and a chromatic scale in multiple
octaves as appropriate. Demonstrate proficiency in singing
pentatonic; major; natural, harmonic, and melodic minor
scales and keys; plus the blues scale.

2E6F06CDF5FB47F5A4F502231A51BCF9.description:
Play or sing with a characteristic tone quality,
perform individual pitches with accurate intonation,
understand intonation tendencies, and adjust during the
performance.

13517DEB877649CFAD0B6C3C3C6AF187.description:
Read and perform with correct pitches, correct
rhythms, printed dynamics, and printed articulations.

457C8BE79915486A99CEB0E1131F8A0A.description: Performing: Artists/students employ personal processes and skills to solve problems creatively and present work in various contexts.Â

4DF7FF01D815475AA2A698874062DA05.description:
Explain how instrument techniques of
multiple instruments create accurate pitch and
how to alter pitch.

92BB20931B4342EFB0739A95CA93C53C.description:
Evaluate and refine simple compositions
and improvisations based on individually
developed criteria.

70EA4D8F02E54911A14A01BC25FB6F91.description:
Select, develop, and notate or record
melodic and rhythmic ideas for a specific purpose
that demonstrates characteristics of music from a
variety of cultures.

7F3E7BCCD6E4442EB0265928C729DC6B.description:
Compose and improvise simple melodic
or rhythmic ideas for a specific purpose. The ideas
should reflect characteristics of music from a
variety of cultures.

FE4F973388AF4C02B23C391266008153.description: Creating: Artists/students use creative thinking and reasoning skills to perceive concepts and ideas to develop works.
